column3: This was an awesome mall. I love how everything is so walkable on Brand. I spent nothing on lyft lol

Soup to nuts you'll find what you need here! Galleria has it all..entertainment, shopping, food, etc. You can buy a delightful chocolate for your sweet or some sports bling for your guy; dine on great food options or shop til you drop.Parking..a bit of a nightmare, but you can manage.

I'm not a fan of malls - I actually hate going to them but this one has a different vibe. It's extremely rare that I go shopping to buy stuff, it's more for visiting one of the restaurants or for people watching. The parking lot can be a nightmare but what do you expect when this is the only transportation option to arrive here.

The Galleria is one of the countries largest, oldest and most popular places in Southern California. It has hundreds of stores, tons of restaurant and is in the heart of the city of GLENDALE. The parking is free, access is very good for every type of person with the exception of elevators. Not too many of those and well they’re very far apart. Stores range from very small to very large. Main ones being Target, (the newest of the big stores) Marcy’s, Bloomingdales, Apple, (The first Apple store in the country) Hollister, Adidas, T-Mobile and ATT and Verizon to name a few.Food in this place is very diverse. From burgers to Mediterranean to Sushi and hot dogs; this place haze it all. And if that wasn’t enough if you walk across the street there’s Brand at Americana. A very upscale mall with more to see. It’s like a two for one. The Galleria has three levels with primary ones for most of the mall and the third one all the way in the back that conecta you to the American across the street. This way if it’s too hot or the rain is crazy you can walk over in air conditioned style. Great place to hang out and one of the cooling stations for the summer if you happen to not have AC. It doesn’t have too many places to Jaír sit with consuming anything, even though you can. Then again it is a mall and they want you to buy, buy, buy. If you’re coming during the Christmas season bring your patients and come out lots of time, or better yet take a taxi. It’s well worth the money spent. It’ll keep you sane. I’ve hear of people being stuck in traffic for 3hrs before they reformed the way cars circulate. Now if it’s bad it’s about 30 minutes to get in or out. Come down and explore this greats place and have lunch while doing a little shopping.
i used to love this mall. now it’s old and no name stores are semi populating it. Maybe malls are just on a downhillbut this one is showing the slide
The inside has lots of shops with a variety for all in your group. Across the street from the Americana outside mall, so you can do both.
With all the talk and media lately of shopping malls being dead. The Glendale galleria is alive with energy.
Just popped in as staying nearby. Really nice mall in the evening with s good atmosphere. Lots of food outlets and nice shops. I liked the fountains which are lit up.

Updates stores, decor, trends (has 2 to compete with Americana X street).Kind of confusing to find way around mall.Unique stores, services.best parking ever.Last saw mall 2 years ago & then back in the 80s.Could update Food Court some.Offer kiosks for services 2.Passport photos etc.Mall ext little changed since builtOlder than Americana @ Brand mall by many years

A good downtown covered mall in a good location. Its not just the shops in the mall that make this good but its the others close by with oots of nearby restaurants as well. Lots of free parking by target. Lots of the big names to be found with jcpenny, macys as big chain department stores.A good place if the weather is extreme.

column2: Very nice mall with plenty of free parking - right across from the Americana!
column3: I love the Galleria. Great place to go with my daughter. Nice shops, eateries and a good place to walk around.
On a Friday in the summer it was very active and fun. The Tesla store was a favorite with the kids. Wasn’t obnoxious or pretentious.

We stopped here for In-N-Out. Parking is available. But crowded. If you have a larger vehicle, just go to the top where there ya more space. We didn’t find a working elevator. In-N-Out had quick service and a nice couple gave us their table. Food was good!

Yes. It's a beautiful and enormous multi-storied shopping mall. And it precisely brings to mind why a few of us bailed out years ago. Southern Cal does so many things well. Many of these things are bigger than life.But all of these things end up in one's driving in circles in the parking structure looking to get lucky and find a parking spot. We finally found one on level six.And then you get into the Galleria and realize this is probably the only time in SoCal that people arrived somewhere in a carpool. However, this is the particular mindset of Angelenos ( I were born one..... so it's not personal) is that the longer the lines, the cooler a place is.Truly every whim and desire can probably be fulfilled here. And I'm sure folks who now call the middle of nowhere home probably would be well advised to avoid visiting shopping venues on weekends.
This is a must to do if you would like a nice clean area to shop in. We spend several hours here on the day we visited!
Our hotel was in Glendale, so we discovered this not far away. Very nice shopping area. There was an area in the middle with like fountains and a trolley. Neat shopping area.

Talk about variety. This mall is massive with plenty of store selections. Not to mention a Target is attached to it and it has a very large food court. Perfect place to find a gift or and outfit for a night out on the town. Be prepared to shop for hours.

column2: Wonderful 0.5m radius of shopping and food
column3: Following a few years of investment this area of Glendale is brand new. Holding all the top fashion named stores, great pedestrian zones and a very clean easy mall.
So many choices for places o eat, watch the waterworks and shop. Love being able to sit outside in nice weather and at Christmastime see the displays. Always have fun.

Lots of familiar big name shops (Target, Macy, etc) along with lesser known stores, many pop-up kiosks, ample food court with something for everyone, clean restrooms. Good place for mallwalkers - lots of exercise possible in circumnavigating the entire place, upstairs and down. A shopping center for the common person, with no pretension to upper, upper class glories.
If you have an electric car or Tesla The top floor has a ton of chargers. Then take the elevator downstairs for food and shopping
This mall is huge with tons of stores! It is indoor so great in any kind of weather. There is a food court with a good amount of choices too.

Visited the mall on Thanksgiving Day. Enjoyed the sale in most of the shops and department stores. Great discounted prices.The mall is very spacious and very comfortable to shop at. Complete with food courts and restos. Very close to Americana too.Unfortunately, learned that the LGU had increased the sales tqx in Glendale to more than 10%. That would be the drawback shopping in this mall.
I loved it ,because when raining,you still can shop in this mall, they have everything available just for you :)

I like it here, but made a mistake buying from Bloomingdales. I bought a belt from Ferragamo and the lady told us it was 380 USD plus taxes. Upon payment they charged me an additional 3.5 percent for service charge. They only told me about the service charge when I was already paying.But I like this mall, they have a Target, Riley Rose and Lush here. It's also a short walk to Americana. Parking is free and easy to find.

My daughter lives just two blocks away from the Galleria and it is beautiful. Very clean, a variety of stores and for parents that have little ones there is much for them to do like a play room on the third floor. I go about two to three times during my visit with my daughter! I'm never bored with the mall at all. A must visit!!

From $1,000 shoes at Bloomingdale's to a three-story Target, this place has EVERYTHING. It took five minutes of driving around, but it was not too hard to find a parking place in the (free) garage adjacent to the mall. Walking distance to a movie theatre.

column2: Very Functional With Diverse Store Selections
column3: This 2-story enclosed mall has the stores that I would shop in including Uniqlo and Hollister. It is spacious, clean and have plenty of parking. The Americana is just across the street.

Holiday Time...no phone call..no stress...only relaxing walks or reading a winter card from a friend at..a cup of coffee 😋Time enough for shopping with pleasure while listening a wonderful Xmas carol!What to wish more???A Happy New Year to all my friends!

column2: Busy mall with great variety of stores.
column3: This is a great mall and I love browsing / shopping here. A good number of stores to suit the whole family, and my husband would often wander into his favourite stores and catch up to me.The mall has a good sized food court but as we were here in early December, Christmas shoppers were also visiting in large numbers so finding a table was near impossible.The crowds made the mall noisy and getting into some stores was a mission, but it was a great few hours spent shopping.Surprisingly, we found a parking spot easily and then headed over to Americana for a spot of shopping as well.I think it is well worth the visit.
This is a charming, fairy tale setting for a mall complete with train ride. Aside from being extremely picturesque, it is a great outdoor space for walking with kids.

column2: The last remodel spoiled the experience
column3: The Galleria was remodeled a while ago and they changed the floor from carpet to hard shiny stone. Now it's very noisy, and a bit cold and unfriendly compared to before. I hardly go there anymore, and prefer the Americana instead. I can't say much about the shops, because they seem to change a lot nowadays. Some of my faves are gone, like Nordstrom.

column2: Large mall with a nice selection of shops
column3: Great place to window or actual shop. Some unique shops. I found it well lite, clean, large walkways with both ramps and stairs to move between levels. Did not visit the second floor but was impressed with the selection at the food court. Definitely worth a visit even if just for the exercise of walking, but I will bet you come away with something that catches your eye.
We often go to Glendale galleria to shop with my kids and buy household products from Target. We like the convenience of visiting Americana as well.

The Glendale Galleria is in the middle of things in Glendale. There is everything from food to entertainment, easy freeway access and reasonable parking. It is close to the Americana and has all the major stores. The Galleria is appropriately themed throughout the year and is well maintained.

column2: Clean, easy to get to, with good parking
column3: Wanted to do a little shopping while visiting LA and the Glendale Gallerie had all of the stores we wanted to visit and was fairly easy to get to from the Westside (not during rush hour). The mall was very clean, parking wasn't terribly difficult, and it was busy but not impossible to navigate or see things.

column2: Loud, unstylish, staff in stores unmotivated or busy with their phones
column3: After having been there a couple of times thereafter, I gave up yesterday. I can not recall one single positive shopping experience there - it's loud, it's unstylish, and everyone seems so unmotivated - when I asked a Galleria employee for directions to the Sprint store she did not even bother to answer.Not that we misunderstand: we tried five stores yesterday willing to spend top dollar - and did go home empty-handed. My wife almost cried at Victoria Secret - the service is absolutely unacceptable there. She rather bought her stuff online then - a killer for any retail store.However: If you are the classic Target customer and The Cheesecake Factory is fine dining for you - you may possibly love this place ;-)

I think this is the biggest shopping mall in the area and even the areas around. many brands. parking sometimes tough on weekends. nice food court with many options. i used to get some good deals for clothes in this place. if you walk outside you will find the Americana at Brand which is a very nice area to walk around (1 min walk).

Went for a short walk here after dinner, as our hotel was across the street. Nice atmosphere. Alot of places to shop,eat or just people watch. Need to come back when on vacation sometime, did no get to see everything.

column2: Average Mall, no thrills, busy parking
column3: Park on the top floor, and walk this very average mall. Theres nothing bad about this mall, its clean and a little older just nothing you haven't seen in every american town.The benefits is it is located within walking distance to the Americana across the street and nearby restaurants.

Been from the UK we love shopping in American shopping centres. This one although not huge has some great shops you can only get in America.There also a good food market with loads of options of where to grab something to eat.
Nice destination for food, shopping, movies etc. Grab a blanket and relax on the grass and enjoy the fountains.
I love this mall! It sure has everything! And its next to the hotel we stayed at. Just walkimg distance.

If you want a day in a huge shopping mall (think Chadstone if you live in Melbourne (then think bigger), definitely head to Glendale Galleria. There's likely every shop you need plus more as well as fountains and trams- the works pretty much! Top of my list was sorting out an international SIM card which was easily done before immersing ourselves amongst the candy stores (well timed two days before Halloween), the Disney store and just the sun and smiles!
Glendale Galleria has been around for close to 50 years and still appears to be successful. Good shopping and a few lower end eating places.The Apple Store at GG was the first one per a staff member.
Really lovely atmosphere here with music playing . Many shops with helpful staff. Food hall with good choices to eat. Bath & body works, A&F, great shops here.

column2: Huge place with many high end shops
column3: PARKING can be a challenge but it's worth it. The food selection covers from fast good to high end Chop Houses.Clientele on a Friday evening was mostly young professionals stopping on the way home from work. There is a Target store adjacent to the Galleria

A great place to stroll, shop, eat and shmooze!Recently remodeled, it is bright and airy. Easily accessible by freeways and local transit. Glendale Beeline stops in front.Across the street from the high-end Americana complex, a perfect pair, a perfect day trip!

I love that this mall has free parking and nice stores. I just wish they had more food court selections. However, each time I go back I see a new restaurant or food stand so hopefully they'll keep them coming!

I live in Burbank where we also have a mall, but my teens prefer to go to Glendale to shop, because there are so many more options there for them. I dint mind the extra driving because i like the mall myself. Its the mall I grew up going to myself and it has many stores I like too. There's even a Target to get the important shopping done for home too.
Lots of branded stores in this mall. Parking is plentiful. Foodcourt is decent but pricey. Overall it's ok. Has a Target, JC Penney and Macy's stores.
This mall has the usual suspects plus some unusual ones. Puts most outlets to shame.The parking is plentiful and free. There are plenty of eateries on Brand from cheap and cheerful to exotic.

column2: Came to use the currency exchange
column3: Came to use the currency exchange booth and they were very helpful. They price matched what Bank of America was going to offer us. We just had the exchange rate Bank of America was offering written down by one of their agents and brought it to them. Came back the next day and they still validated the same rate as the previous day.

It’s a nice, clean mall with a good selection of stores for the whole family. Large food court with lots of seats, the kabob store has halal chicken. Toilets are plentiful. Just a short walk from the Americana as well. Happy to find Teavana, we spent way too much money there.
After the remodel the place looks a lot better and higher end...Very clean and good assortment of shops and food court
Best place for shopping in Glendale, nice location, parking, food court with different kinds of international meals, beautiful stores and staff

I love this place to shop or window-browse ... Not too big nor small... Plenty of stores to choose from... All my favourite stores are actually there that's why I love going there any day of the week- Hollister, Abercrombie, Uniqlo, Victoria Secret, Target, Foot Locker, Michael Kors, Macy's, Bloomingdales & so on...
This mall is really beautiful at night especially at Christmas! I love all the stores and restaurants! It is really nice. We usually valet and they are quick to get the car!

column2: I love shopping at Glendale Galleria
column3: Glendale Galleria has good shopping. Bloomingdales, Zara, Coach, Michael Kors, Macys, JC Penneys and many other shopping. Even Target is there. There is the Fast Fix for little repairs to your jewelry. They have a Food Court with many variation of Food, even McDonalds is there. Parking is easy, two levels and no validation.

I went to this mall because another store didn't have what I needed and it was amazing. It has a Target attached to it(one stop shop).The mall is clean mixed crowd in a good area,free parking and has lots of stores with sales.Go here its a good mall and the stores seem bigger here
The Glendale Galleria is a very big mall. The configuration is a little wonky but it has a vast selection of stores.
The Glendale Galleria is a very nice indoor shopping center with stores to meet anyones taste and also food stores. Nice place to shop especially on a rainy or hot day.
I love the outdoor malls in Southern California and the layout of this mall is good. It’s a great place to walk and wrangle little ones or to keep your tweens and teens busy.

Large mall in the centre of Glendale. Wonderful selection of all the top stores. Across the road from the fabulous Americana at Brand courtyard with its fabulous waterfalls and restaurants. There is a food court but only if you like fast food. It is very large with multiple levels so be prepared for a long walk through the mall. Free parking and plenty of spaces.

Ive been to the mall many times and always found something I want to buy.There are places to eat, drink coffee and a sweet shop.It's easy to park which is a bonus in LA with parking a a premium everywhere you go.
wide selection of shops and food. you need at least couple of hours to get around. it has for example nice jewelry shop from Hawaii.

When you need something, you're likely to find it at the Glendale Galleria. Beyond the many department stores that are here, there're shops of every different sorts. I go back often. When you need to find something, you're most likely going to find it here. Plus, adjacent to the Glendale Galleria is another shopping center, very high-end, that can extend your shopping possibilities even further.

Glendale Galleria is a great place to visit. It feels very comfortable and clean. The stores are some of the best in the area. The whole shopping experience is always very nice. The shopping covers that gamut of stores from H&M to Bloomingdales and the food is exceptional. This is a great place to spend the afternoon or a fun evening.

This is a nice multilevel mall with all the major department stores along with smaller shops too. A nice place to walk around in between doing Hollywood tours etc. A huge 3 level Target is also in this mall.

it has all my shopping needs.good stores. interesting kiosks and restaurants. downside is Target which overran the south end of mall and parking structure and thebAmericana shoppers...target shoppers just took over and Americana charges to park so people park here and walk to Americana making it a nightmare if all you want todo is ray at the galleria.
This is a very large mall with free parking. Many large stores in a clean environment. The only downside is that you can't access all the portion of the mall easily.

column2: Great mall if you have teens! Crowded but very clean and a good variety of stores.
column3: Yes this is just like any other major mall in the US but it also has some stores that I have not been too. There's an H & M and a Lush store which is really cool. It was a bit crowded so if you are not into that you may want to pass on it. They also have a 3 story Target which was cool. That was a first for us..A good way to pass a few hours if you are bored.

To me it was just another sterile American style shopping Mall. All the usual generic stores with the same old products & department stores which are difficult to navigate! There is an outdoor area nearby with shops & restaurants & fountains etc which I though was very fake, artificial and characterless, but if you're unfortunate enough to be staying in this part of LA then there ain't much else to do here than wander around aimlessly around this mall!!
Indoor and outdoor shops. This mall is huge with a big varieties of products. Many amenities nearby. All varieties of food
We enjoyed the Galleria. It's a great Mall, just across the street from another great Mall. The Galleria has upscale stores as well as a fantastic food court! Enjoy! Parking is decent here as well!

All sorts of high end shops as well as specialty shops that will satisfy even the pickiest of shoppers. Great food park. Masis Kabob...International Grill...Not sure which name it is under... however, definitely a must try if you love Mediterranean fare. The #11 is my personal favorite!
You will find most of the brand names in this Galleria; and it's a nice place to escape from the summer heat too; shop till you drop, or just enjoy a leisurely stroll; lots of eating choices.

I like this place. They have a wide array of selections on stores to shop with plenty of ample parking you will not have a hassle finding one. The mall is also right across from the Americana mall which gives you more items to choose from.
I felt like I was walking into Disneyland! If you're in the area you must stop and stroll through shops and restaurants and of course the beautiful music and the dancing waters!

This mall was easy to walk and find what i needed. The big stores were well organized by floor. I expected a little more variety in food for what appeared as an upscale mall but it had the usual picks. Parking was easy.

Huge shopping mall that seems connected and adjacent to another huge shopping mall. You can walk and shop and eat for the better part of a day here. Often crowded, but always feels safe. Plenty of free parking in the structures around (even if you have to circle a bit). Best highlight (for me): there's a LEGO Store inside!

This is probably the easiest and best place to go shop for clothes etc in Los Angeles. The main square across from the shopping centre has restaurants and is clean - I usually go when I need anything and I live in West Hollywood.

While we were in Glendale, my husband and I visited both this mall and the Americana across the street. This mall is an indoor mall with every store you could ask for. It is a busy mall and a nice place to spend a rainy day.

The Glendale Galleria is supposed to be California's top malls. It is definitely upscale that to me is just a ordinary Mall. I think if you're an older person who has some walking disability this is not a good place for you for there were steps in the mall. And the floors tile and white sometimes it's hard to see the steps coming. The mall the setup like an octopus different Outlets so if you go from one into the mall it's very hard. And there so many different parking structures you really have to concentrate remember where you parked at.

column2: High End Mall that's goods to people watch and enjoy a sunny day
column3: This is shopping with an entertainment experience. All the high end shops are here if that's what you want but go just to enjoy the landscape architecture and people watching.

column2: A Nice Way to Spend the Day
column3: An indoor huge mall, from low-end to up-scale shopping. Good food, great atmosphere, ample parking and easy access. My advice is to get there early, especially on weekends because it tends to get crowded quickly!!!

It's a heaven for me my favorite place to shop and to eat. Glendale gallery is my home because all my favorite stores are there and it's to close to my home I feel safe there. You can find all kinds of things in different stores. You should check it out it's fun place
Great shopping area with a three story Target! Has a good food court with many choices. Indoor shopping area

Glendale Galleria is a perfect place for shopping. Here u can buy everything from Rolex watches to cheap clothing. This mall has it all. Nice climate and a pleasant lighting makes it easy to spend lots of time.
Amazing shopping mall. Full of activities and stores. Restaurants and coffees available too. A lot of things suitable for all family members. Really amazing

The Mall is huge. They literally have every store you can imagine. I took my daughter to see Santa last weekend and that was the only thing I hated. When did any mall make you do an appointment to see Santa, then the computer be down? My 3 year old was upset and so was I. Other than this, the mall is the best in the valley area.

Glendale Galleria is a great typical American indoor shopping mall, with every kind of shop you could be looking for, as well as an excellent food court. If you want to experience an American mall with a full range of choices, this is definitely where you should go!
Outdoors mall with lots of shops !Ice creamCoffeeBookstoreTrendy storesTrainTourist site 👀👍And a golden car too

column2: Great Mall with lots of variety in shops and food outlets
column3: Teens wanted to spend so much time here, great quality food court, lots of variety in shops. The Sweet Shop alone took us 30 mins to explore.

column2: Typical suburban type mall - appeared safe and clean
column3: Typical mall plus a three story Target (check out the shopping cart escalator). Large JCPenneys. Sees Candy. Large and varied food court. Free parking in adjacent parking structure.

I felt the place is very cute,the shops are nicely organised,all kinds of shopping is available almost everything u need ,good food court too.excellent choice for shopping with children as they enjoy this the most.
My sister and I went because we wanted to purchase specific clothing. We didn't find any of the items, but we had a great time looking!
I went here together with my family. They had fun especially my 1yr old boy. He liked it so much running around the park and was amazed with the fountain works. This place is perfect for families!
Plenty of room. Most shops off wide main thoroughfare. Expensive. Dicks sports shop stocks a wide range of sporting goods.

column2: Wonderful place to shop, dine and enjoy city life
column3: This is basically an outdoor extension of the Americana shopping area, but this shopping is even better, imho. More shops, better selection, better bargains. The entire area is great for just getting out and about to enjoy city life. There are so many other things to do within and very close to the shopping. The restaurants are among the best in a tight knit area of any city this size.
Really enjoyed my time here. Really nice outside area between Galeria and Americana and a wide range of shops as well.Great place to be on a nice sunny day.

column2: What a find this place is! A beautiful well designed shopping and eating destination
column3: We heard about this place from a local foodie and keen fashion blogger/shopper.Totally worth the drive to Glendale to experience this very charming and pleasant outdoor shopping village. It looks like something you would see in Europe. The range of stores and places to eat are enough to please any budget and palate. You can fine dine or grab a quick bite to eat - the choice is yours. And Choice is what this place has going for it - there is enough here to please all. The range of stores is a really great mix - everything from eclectic to mainstream. Well done Glendale - who knew!

column2: Still one of the best malls in S California
column3: Malls are becoming obsolete in many areas. But the Galleria remains one of the best in Southern California.
Compering to Armenian shopping centers Glendale Gallery so small. Just kidding so enormous you can get lost thereeny shops for tourist it is good place to be and shopPrices are good and quality high

I did not like this place much. It is a funny looking mall. The parking was nice and free. Food court was nice but some of the people eating there were questionable looking. I would not go out of my way to shop here. Did not feel quite safe to buy lots of things without being watched if you know what I mean.

The Glendale Galleria is a fantastic place for shopping. They have revamped the place, with new floors and shops. There are a variety of different shops to choose from. I love eating at the food court, and it seems like everyone does too because it's usually packed with many people. There is something for everyone as there is a playground for the little ones as well. For me, there's always so much to do, which is why I come again and again...
Galleria is a great place to shop with a large variety of stores. Has great eatery places .As well as being across the street to the Americana. Free parking available at the mall

Stopped to go to Sprinkles Cupcakes and walked around. It is beautiful especially at night with the string lights,fountain, and music! Nice stores not found at the run of the mill malls. Definitely worth the trip. Also if you have a college ID TopShop gives 10% discount and tax exempt!

column2: Was good but nothing new and no areas for my kids
column3: The place was good and clean, with good stores for shopping but for me, was hard having 3 kids, I don't say don't come, but if you bring little kids, probably you don't have much options.

column2: Average mall, very busy in the afternoon
column3: This is a good clean mall with many of the usual brand shops you expect to see in most malls. Good free parking behind Macy's and a target added on as well.A good mall to spend a morning before it gets to busy.Food court nothing special.

Okay in terms of stores and places to eat this is great! With that being said parking is a nightmare, the large amount of people make shopping here anything but enjoyable. Not mention the over lack of politeness. Also either because of the enormous amount of people or poor air conditioning this place was hot as hell! I will never shop here again. It was so horrible I would rather drive anywhere else then have to deal with this place ever again.
This is a very good Mall to go shopping and dining with kids! The boys had fun and the foud court has many option for meals. I reccomend this place!

When Americana opened across the street, it looked like the Galleria would sink with the loss of Nordstroms. But the Galleria has improved itself and now the Americana and Galleria complement each other very well. Parking is easier at the Galleria since it is free and you don't have to worry about getting validations like at Americana. There is a wide variety of stores and the mall is anchored by Bloomingdales, Macy's and Target (yes, Target). Being indoors, it can be much more comfortable on those hot summer days, too.

A lot of people think that since The Americana opened that Glendale Galleria is history but i can assure you that, this isnt the case, Glendale Galleria still offer a great deal of luxury and upscale stores, plus it offers free parking, which the American charge you for it

The changes made to the mall is mostly gear for the youngster Most of the clothes is store is for the teen very disappointing. Have to shop in Macys or JC Penney if you looking for mature wear.. All the small stores nice clothes but not for mature wearerOther wise the mall is ok , food court ok.

A place to spend the day for shopping, gastronomic curiosity and your money will go a long way, from posh star shopping down to very affordable but quality stuff is available... There is a space for everyone, from kids to elderly. This mall offers great selection of stores, ample parking and location is accesible to major freeways...

We come from the metro Chicagoland area where malls are plenty...this hands down was one of my favorite malls. Stores, restaurants, carts, green space that was outstanding. Once the sun went down, there was a large fountain area with seating around it and the waters danced to music..it was like being at the Bellagio in Las Vegas! What a show! Compact shopping, but very adequate and another mall right across the street!
I grew up not too far from the mall and shopped here with family and friends often. It's a huge mall with a variety of fun stores. Give yourself time to explore and enjoy!
The shopping was good!! The food too!!! Must try food court. Reasonable pricing but huge portions. But looking for the restroom is a chore

column2: Glendale Galleria is amazing and HUGE her are plenty of shops to keep you busy basically all Day
column3: Glendale Galleria is a very popular mall for visitors and people who lives in LA. Parking is FREE but it can be challenging during the holidays, you may find parking (The Americana next door).Now I will share a SECRET with you USUALLY the best place to find parking even on weekends is Target side this is in 2nd/3rd floor. I go to Glendale Gallery at least 3 to 4 time a year and is really clean and new and the amount of stores to choose from are great. However, many stores the prices are very high. The Glendale Galleria has every store you can think of, like Victory Secrets, Macys, Apple Store, Bloomingdale's. Forever21,Bath & Body Works, Papaya, Zara etc. . I used to go to Sephora but now has moved over to AMERICANA as I mentioned before is just next door of Glendale Gallery. At this Galleria you can find plenty of DELICIOUS INTERNATIONAL food options at the food court and price are REALLY good.

column2: In front of The Americana at Brand
column3: That's why this mall is great. Although the two malls are not connected the area is nice clean and safe. It's a really pleasant place to be.
Great variety of stores where you can find anything and everything you want. Lots of parking space and it's free.
So many and too many choices...my kind of shopping ! If you wanna go to this mall don't take the kids ..
Everyone I encountered was very helpful and nice. They also have a good variety of shops. Parking was easy & free.

column2: Development in the area has made ut congested
column3: While there are some nice stores and places to eat around the mall, Glendale has decided to build A LOT of apartments in the area which is making the area congested. Plus, with an aging population there are a minimal number of handicap parking spots. Many people park at the Galleria and walk over to the Americana across the street so they don't have to pay for parking. I've stopped going to the Galleria and instead head over to Santa Anita. It has many of the same stores and it is easier to park.

Been here only a few hours at night and may I say it is beautiful. Didn't get a chance to see the tram that goes around it. Good for kids. Awesome for shopaholics with money. Fountain is awesome as well especially with the music. Great place to have a date, walk aroun and shop then eat.

The Glendale Galeria just about has it all for a fun complete shopping excursion. Ranges in price from medium-low to almost high end. We shopped Target to Nordstrom with ease of access and nice layout of stores between the big anchors. Also popular with tourists as several shopping groups were seen. Also has a food court. Pretty nice. Enjoy! .....

column2: Great Shopping Day Combined with Americana!
column3: Inside mall with free parking has Bloomingdale's, Target and Macy's as anchor stores. The Galleria includes shopping for kids to their upscale grandmas! Just across the street is the Americana--an outside upscale mall with a variety of upscale shopping including Nordstrom, movie theatres and great dining choices. Glendale Galleria and the Americana together offer the only upscale shopping in the area.
Lots of everything here. Upscale mall. Everything from Godiva to Target. Great rainy day destination.
Had a lovely day shopping here at Glendale! Lots of lovely shops and friendly people! Nice places to stop and have a drink.

Ever since we discovered Glendale Galleria, it has become a must do each time we visit L.A. This indoor shopping mall has everything from Best chocolate/candy/soda/ice cream shop, excellent food, and plenty of shopping that no one will be disappointed.
This has to be one of the biggest malls I have been too! The parking was easy, which is a miracle since it's always a struggle!
The Mall: Many retail stores & kiosks. Lots varieties. Nicely maintained. It is fun shopping at this mall. Not super crowded.The Parking: Parking structure and it is FREE parking!

column2: Great Food Court and major shopping mall to cater to all.
column3: Glendale my City 17 years ago before I moved out. The City is close to Downtown Los Angeles and offers great residential and proximity of major attraction such as Universal Studio, Griffith Park and Observatory, Rose Bowl and Burbank Airport, Glendale Memorial and major golf courses. The Galleria is a perfect mall to hang around and shop with convenience of easy parking. The Northern part of Glendale offers nice homes and neighborhood as well.
Nice place to spend a day. Full of shops and dining places... Really enjoyed spending the day there ... also done ALOT of shopping..
Need I say more??? This place is a shoppers paradise with everything you can think of just go and check it out for yourself you won't want to miss out on this shoppers heaven
Here you have many Good brands which you will love to shop.Nice Food court. Especially i loved "Massis Kabob The Original Kabobery".this is huge mall,you need at least two days to explore it all.
Had to spend the day killing time, so went to the Galleria mall and had a wonderful day. Many great shops and even a 3 story Target. Very Cool!

While visiting my daughter in Los Angeles, she took me to wander around the Galleria. It is full of expensive top-line shops. My favorite was Anthropologie. The area is so clean and elaborate. If you are looking for somewhere to go where you feel safe and you want to shop, this is a nice place.
Great place.. so many stores in one place. Loved Americana st. Where most of the restaurants are. Take tennis shoes or confy lightweight shoes...

column2: Much Improved and Great Indoor Mall !
column3: I had not been to the Galleria for quite some time - since before Bloomingdale's arrived -- it was so much nicer to go to the Americana (less crowded, not dingy). Well, what a pleasant surprise when I returned recently with an out of town friend to look for evening wear she was needing! This is a lovely and huge mall : ) Bloomingdale's is AWESOME, the Blaze Pizza was fantastic - and everything seems fresh and new. Good job Glendale!!
Great place to go to find what you want. It has many stores from big names like Macy's to small boutique stores. Has ample parking and a big food court. Also there are many restaurants near by.

column2: Two shopping levels and lots of free parking.
column3: Lots of stores on two levels and plenty of free parking. It does get crowded but was renovated and is very pleasant for walking and shopping. You can walk early in the morning for exercise or during the mall hours for shopping or eating.

column2: Huge shopping Mall. Most likely you will find what you are after
column3: This is a huge place for shopping.Most stores are there, as well as many eating options for a wide variety of food.I liked the fact that parking lot is convenient, free and spacious.They also have free wi-fi for guests.Wonderful place

This place is huge. There is an outdoor and indoor area. Plenty of stores to shop in, restaurants and a movie theatre as well. There is a little park area outside near the fountain and they give out blankets which many couples and families took advantage of. People were laying down or sitting down just soaking in the sun. They even ahad a bean bag toss game area for the kids in the lawn as well. There was a cable car that took you for a mini ride towards the fountain area. Simply a great location for all ages.

Went to Karens Toy store to purchase a birthday present my mother had her service dog with her and after about 10 min. of looking she started to walk over to ask the cashier how much the item she wanted to purchase was when the manager of the stir said "Stop you can't be in this stir with the dog". It was explained, it was a service dog, then the manager said "I'm allergic to dogs , you have to leave now!" Mom told him it was a poodle and was non allergic, the manager then said, "I'm alert if to poodles! Leave the stir now!I told him it was against the law to not permit a working dog, and she would report this incident, again she was told to leave. It was very upsetting to be kicked out of the store and not be able to buy the gift we wanted, the Mall managment was informed and said they would call the owner of the store, nothing was heard from anyone after that! If you have a service dog or any dog as all dogs are allowed in this mall stay away from Karen's Toys they obviously don't want your business if you had a dog with you! Had a great day.

Visit. Walk. Enjoy. So many stores. Such a variety. And a food court that offers a wide variety of options. Especially nice to get out of the heat on the occasional hot days in Glendale. But don't forget to go ACROSS THE STREET to the Americana. THAT is worth the trip for sure.
Large shopping mall, lots of stores, but crowded parking, and really no decent stores for the larger woman.

This places keeps getting better and better. New stores. Bloomingdale's makes a great anchor and has wonderful sales. Macy's -- something old and familiar -- also has a million sales. The food options improve as well. Blaze pizza is there to refuel your shopping energy. There's a Korean bibimbap place opening soon.
This is one of the largest shopping mall I visit. And I visit often because there are so many stores that just seems to have most everything I need.
A very well presented, expensive looking mall! Anything you need you will find here. Lots of nice places to eat, sit down , relax. A wide range of shops with a Macy's and Bloomingdales!

This is a good alternative to the south coast plaza, much more friendly with many of the same shops combined with the Americana. Make sure you park here father than the Americana as parking is free. Not the biggest Macy's if you are after that department store.Some good food choices around as well. Will be back.

column2: Great restaurants around and spectacular fountains
column3: I liked how smart this shopping/eating area is. It appealed to my snobby side. Could happily have returned night after night to try out all the restaurants but alas only had 3 days in the area. The fountains were spectacular to watch.
A prime Indoor Shopping Center with a whole host of brand name shops and eateries with convenient parking structure.

Just a quick tip. Park at the galleria if you're going to the Americana. You can go to both malls even if you're parked in the galleria structure (which is free). I usually stay at the galleria but there's a Forever 21, H&M, and an urban outfitters right across the street at the Americana. Just my two cents :)

column2: ALWAYS SOMETHING TO DO OR BUY THERE
column3: I've been shopping at the Glendale Galleria since it's been built. I live close by. Has great stores and a terrific food court. Always find bargains there. Great place to shop or just ppl watch.
We only go to the Galleria if we have to. Parking can be a problem on the weekends. Still, it's a good destination with a variety of stores.
This shopping center has been around for ever, but they keep remodeling it and bringing it up to date. It is massively large, so you can always find what you are looking for.

I liked the organization of the parking structure, but the valet getting in and out of the parking structure can be quite confusing. Also if you go watch a movie in the theater there, you can get validated for four hours free.

I love this Mall because it has almost everything that you Need, including Restaurants as well as ist Food court.. Lots of parking & very convenient. Its Close to downtown Glendale & all the other stores as well as cinemas. Not too big that you get overwhelmed.
It was a pleasant shopping place with lots of affordable food choices nearby. I enjoyed going around this very accessible mall.

We found this mall by chance, but was a great surprise!big mall with several stores, and across the street there's another beautiful area with a plaza and a fountain, and also some several other business like Apple Store, Barnes & Nobles, Cheesecake Factory.

What made the experience so pleasant was that the parking was free while the other mall charged parking beyond two hours, even if it was only a fraction of the following hour (this if you had your ticket validated by one of the shops.) Galleria is the older mall and although it did not have a dancing fountain, it's still worth going to and you could check out the deals. Clean and wide spaces. An assortment of food at the Food Court. Excellent!

Centre was clean, modern and quiet. Some great boutique style shops along with your bigger chains. Typical of a westfield style layout so easy to navigate. Parking easy and nearby are some restaurant options.

column2: Very nice shopping centre with everything
column3: Went today with my wife, enjoyed the shops, found some great deals. The area looked like a nice area too, and safe. The outside area with the fountains looked very posh and classy too, really enjoyed the day there .

You better have on your walking shoes if you plan to spend much time here or the Americana across the street. There is definitely something for everyone at these malls. I dropped my husband and boys off for a movie and had 3 wonderful hours of mall shopping. It was a mad house right before Christmas but fine to navigate alone.
Same old same old stuff, but it works for California. I don't want to pay retail but you might. It's ok to just walk around in and not spend money too.

column2: An Unexpected Treasure in Downtown Glendale, California
column3: Hey, we were just looking for a Goodwill!! Imagine our great surprise thrill when I happened to look across the street and spied an inconspicuously placed, huge chandelier above a side street - Whaat?? This required investigating, right? We mosied across the street with no real expectation. And then...WOW! An elegant, beautiful oasis in the city - truly! I highly recommend a visit. I posted pics taken there on my blog - the link to this article is (drum roll, plz)http://mobilemidlifecatharsis.wordpress.com/2014/09/28/hey-we-were-ju…-glendale-trip.Great for couples, kiddies ( park where they can run around, watch the dancing fountains, eat ice cream), teenagers with full wallets.
had everything we needed here. we were just having a chill out day, after driving down the cost for 5 days, and staying in LA.

Overall this mall has the same stores as the majority of southern California malls, except for a few select and this is why I travel out there. The vendors have been a bit more aggressive lately unlike before and its ruins the shopping experience a tad bit.

column2: Great shopping--easy taxi ride from downtown hotels
column3: Great variety of shops to chose from. Easy taxi ride from downtown. Happy to see a full service See's Candy shop at this location

The mall is like any other mall with the exception of a seemingly disproportionate number of vendors who stop shoppers hustling for business. I was stopped 5 times on the bottom floor alone within 10 minutes. Some of those hustling for business were nice and pleasant but others quite intrusive and inappropriate: "Do you have someone special in your life?" one asked me while another touched my shoulder and said "What do you do when your muscles are sore?". I did not want to be rude but after a while it was a bit tasking not o be so. I understand that those guys had to do their job but still I felt it was too much. It was quit an unpleasant experience for me shopping at the Galleria and I am not planning to shop thee again soon.
Nothing spectacular, just the usual coterie of upscale shops that offer nothing of real value, but drain the consumers dollar. One or two really worthwhile shops.

I always visit this mall. It looks grander and updated now with its renovation done. There are new shops. They have a good mix of shops good for all types of shoppers. There is Target for those price conscious shoppers and Bloomingdales for those savvy ones. They renovated the food court too, and there are good choices - from Hotdog on a bun to Panda Express, there is Brazilian and Japanese... etc... Walk across Central avenue to go to Americana. Love to shop here!

The new remodel is a great improvement.Lots of shops with something for every budget. Nordstrom's is no longer there- moving next door to the Americana. The brand new Bloomingdales is sleek and modern with very eager sales staff. With the holidays coming up expect large crowds. Be patient and you will find parking.

They finally did some upgrades to this place. They replaced the dark carpet with tile which looks really nice. Nordstrom's is moving to the Americana so it will be interesting to see how that works out

I dread going to this mall, the layout is awful! It is a long L shape, there's Nordstrom, Macys, JCP and Target of all stores! Oddly the ends of the mall where Target and Nordstrom are located have 3 levels while the middle sections JCP & Macys have 2 stories. I think whoever engineered and designed this mall was clearly not thinking of its customers and how inconvenient it is to get from one end to the other. The main food court is located near Macys/JCP side while another smaller food court is located near Nordstrom on the 3rd level. On this visit in June 2013, they were again doing construction. Some of the corridors had the stairs all ripped up, it looked like they're installing a second elevator near JCP which is much needed since the single elevator barely does much to alleviate the swarm of tired visitors. The corridors are not wide enough, barely wide enough to accomodate folks who insists on walk side by side (3-4 at a time), go visit Cerritos or Lakewood Mall and you'll see and enjoy the difference. You can actually fit a few wheelchair and strollers in the same side of the corridor at Cerritos and Lakewood. While trolling through the mall, I noticed there were only a few benches laid out near JCP and they were all taken by exhausted shoppers. If this mall is so wonderful and popular, why doesn't it put out more benches and seating for folks who need a break from the 4+ hour ordeal? I don't want to trek over to either food court to find seating. Over the years, the food court options have gone from ok to nay! No more Kyochon and if you want a descent burger, In-N-Out is located on Brand so not quite walking distance when you are hungry. While I was on the second floor by Charlotte Russe, the tile floor reflected light from the ceiling which made it appear as if there were steps so it tricks your mind into thinking you might miss a step. I recommend Galleria only if you want to be annoyed with parking, find the ever elusive merchandise not offer at any other malls because this location is not worth the headache or hassle. I hate the parking as there's never enough space for two cars to pass because if one car is waiting for a spot and there's a line of cars behind the waiting car, you can't go around them. When exiting the mall, there's a convoluted route to follow to exit so its not a straight shot to get out of the awkward structure of maze where some areas are again 2 stories while other parts have 4 stories.

column2: Beautiful Courtyard, Gorgeous Fountains & A Perfect Afternoon
column3: This location is beautiful! The fountain in the center is soothing, fun to watch (as it changes its patterns) and nice to sit on the edge and talk, or people watch. The noise of the water carries through the whole courtyard, and really adds to the ambiance.There is a good selection of stores, and none of them are too expensive, so they appeal to everyone. There is also a movie theatre, and several restaurants. Across the street is the actual galleria, which is a basic shopping mall, though still quite large and with a good selection. However, the outdoor courtyard is definitely more worth the visit. It has better restaurants, many with outdoor seating, and much more fun to stroll through. On a sunny day, which is easy to come by in la, it makes for a perfect afternoon of entertainment. It can make for a very romantic day, walking, holding hands and sitting by the fountain. There is also a big playground for children, and stores they would be interested in like LEGO, so it can be a good place for families too.
I was in a family reunion and came here to do a little shopping,I was impressed with the selection. Stores I had always wanted to go to and were not available from where Im from.

Interesting mall with Apple Store and LEGO Store. There was a nice chocolate store tho i forgot the name. And there was a kiosk which you can put your face on little teddy bears. Very cute. Also with Target. Food court was not too bad.

This mall has a nice mix of stores, with something for everyone. Nordstrom, Macy*s, Apple, Disney, and five stars especially for having the only LEGO store in all of the Greater Los Angeles area!The only minor issue was the salespeople in the store carts through the center of the first floor of the mall randomly approach for solicitation, but depending on whom you ask, they might just be doing their job.Good pleasant fun.

This is a very large mall located in Glendale (near North Hollywood). It has every shop you can think of, and an abundance of restaurants as well. I highly recommend this mall to anyone shopping in the Glendale area! You will not be disappointed!!!

The Galleria is a great place for shopping, the main mall area is aged, but its large and clean. Outside you have the Americana outdoor area, which is very nice and upscale. Definitely a good place to spend the day browsing stores.

column2: As long as the Empire State Building is tall!
column3: The Glendale Galleria is huge. I recall being told when it opened, eons ago, that is was as "long as the Empire State Building is tall" since then it has be expanded and upgraded numerous times. The diversity of shops, food choices, and convenient parking brings me back time after time.

column2: Very disappointed , will not be recommending.
column3: Having made a trip of a lifetime to America, with our severely disabled son. We went to the is mall during the Los Angeles section of our trip. We made our way to the customer service desk to enquire about a wheelchair to take our son around the mall. We were told in no uncertain terms, which was also clarified by the manager over the phone, that if you didn't have a valid California state driving licence that you would not be entitled to avail of a wheelchair. I find it hard to believe that if you are travelling form a foreign country and you want to shop and SPEND money, that you should be discriminated against for having a disabled child. I have already emailed the customer services section on their website and as yet no one has had the common courtesy to respond. I know this will have no impact on most people reading this review, BUT if you ever have to travel with a disabled child you will realise how difficult it can be. The Glendale Galleria stood out, as we have experienced nothing but extraordinary customer service in America. I will wait to find out if we ever receive any response.

One of my favorite areas in L.A. Shopping is great, but the environment is what gets me. I love the Bermuda grass surrounding the beautiful fountain. The area is always clean and just a great shopping experience all around.

We went to this mall to go to lego store. We found one item with 10% discount. Not much but O.K. The staff at this lego store here was very helpful. The negative point was, there was homeless people inside the mall, especially when you are having your meal at the food court. They come to your table with a piece of paper stated their conditions.
Every year we visit the USA, no matter how long our stay is in Southern California we always set aside a day to visit this beautiful shopping centre. Great stores in a beautiful location

column2: A good collection of shops, fairly close to Hollywood
column3: We visited here as our big day of shopping on our trip to the US. it was a good place to shop as it had a god variety of shops, and several department stores.
Nice shopping. The concierge was very nice to find me a taxi

column2: Too beautiful to call it a mall!
column3: The Galleria is one of the increasingly popular venues that feature upscale condos on the same premises as upscale retail and restaurants. There are the expected upscale retailers like Apple Store, Williams Sonoma, Coach, Ann Taylor, Abercrombie and Fitch, et. but also a host of great places to eat and the big retailers like Macys, Nordstrom, JCP. Bloomingdales is coming next year! A shopper's paradise. However, the reason I say it is too good to call it a Mall, is that it has beautiful appointments such as an exquisite centerpiece fountain that (during night when we visited) features a dancing water to musical accompaniment. Sounds hokey, but was very well done. (It isn't the World of Color show at Disneyland -- but close -- and costs a helluva lot less!) There is also a vintage trolley that circles through the mall for those who are tired of walking, which is a nice touch. And then, there are the beautiful condos and lobby that you must pass through to access parking (at least we had to in order to get to our car). The combined effect of the above was to create a very pleasurable shopping experience. Judging by the well dressed, well behaved yet animated crowds, I was not alone in this assessment. If you are in or near Glendale, it is worth a visit (especially after dark to see the fountain).
Glendale Galleria is a great shopping mall with many good high street shops, nothing too high end.

This is a great shopping centre which is connected to another group of shops across the road called Americana. There is every shop in this mall that you need. All the big names and big department shops. A huge Target and Macy's. You could spend a day here no problem.

column2: Large mall, great variety, lots to see/buy.
column3: Iv'e gone here many times and always have great memories. Lots of shops, this is a large mall with many more shops in the immediate surrounding area. Parking is sometimes limited and especially difficult to find during peak holiday shopping season. Would recommend to either go early in the morning to find parking or avoid the traffic.
pre-teens running around. lots of the usual brand names.
